abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Electricity Market
            Project for Romania were as follows: outcomes were highly
            satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was moderate,
            the Bank performance was satisfactory, and the Borrower
            performance was highly satisfactory. Some lessons learned
            included: competitively designed and organized competitive
            bidding among qualified contractors gave Compania Nationala
            de Transport al Energiei Electrice (Transelectrica) good
            performance at competent prices, well below original cost
            Estimates, also self-evident but nevertheless a lesson worth
            noting. The development of a functioning electricity market
            is a complex undertaking which Romania, the Government and
            the project's three executing agencies, accomplished
            successfully with the support of the project. A clear
            strategy (the road map); competent and committed staff in
            three executing agencies; close coordination between the
            agencies, with the Government, and with the European
            Commission and the Bank; and support by highly qualified
            consultants with hands-on experience were the key
            ingredients for Romania's success. Transelectrica
            experiences and expects increasing challenges, difficulties,
            and delays in its projects involving land acquisition. To
            mitigate land acquisition delay risks, the Government could
            explore amendments to Romania's land acquisition
            framework for those energy projects which the Government
            deems to be priority projects of public/national interest.
            This can be done by streamlining procedures and updating the
            law in force, in order to avoid delays due to disputes
            settlement over compensation levels.
